oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: General Benjamin F. Cheatham
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of General Benjamin F. Cheatham in military uniform.

Benjamin Franklin "Frank" Cheatham (October 20, 1820 - September 4, 1886) was a general in the Confederate States Army during the American Civil War from Nashville, Tennessee. He served in the Army of Tennessee and inflicted many casualities on Sherman at Kennesaw Mountain, however he was blamed for General Schofield's escape at Spring Hill, a major factor in the Confederate defeat at Franklin.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: W.G. & A.J. Thuss
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Military officers; Soldiers
